This release focuses on more reliable VKB‑Link detection and connection with a clearer, quieter UI. It also reduces startup pop‑ups and tightens packaging and release‑note consistency.

### Improvements
- Uses native Windows process detection with a quieter log and no flashing console windows during background checks.
- Preferences clearly reflect what’s available: controls disable/hide when management isn’t available, with guidance when VKB‑Link must be downloaded and run manually.
- Continuously watches for VKB‑Link starting or stopping (even if launched manually) and runs the normal reconnect flow automatically.
- Connection status reflects a live network link; if VKB‑Link stops, the status updates immediately.
- Managed downloads and updates work even without extra encryption components by using a built‑in fallback.
- Release notes use a consistent format across versions, and changelog/release notes remain source‑neutral (author attribution removed).

### Bug Fixes
- Startup now respects the Auto‑manage setting; VKB‑Link is not launched when auto‑manage is turned off.
- Avoids false restarts and connection failures by preferring the correct configuration file name.
- Waits briefly after detecting a manually started VKB‑Link before connecting, reducing flakiness.
- Corrects fallback behavior when discovering the configuration file location.
- Prevents unexpected command windows from appearing during EDMC startup.
- Interprets on/off values safely so strings like “false” don’t accidentally enable features.

### Packaging
- Includes all required modules so startup and auto‑manage fixes ship with the plugin.
- Bundles the built‑in encryption fallback so managed operations work without extra installs.
- Disables automatic installation of encryption components by default and only attempts it when appropriate to avoid pop‑ups.
- Normalizes stamped release summaries so release notes stay uniform.
